intro: Gochnatia rosei, commonly known as the silky bush. It is a flowering plant native to southern Africa, characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is known for its aromatic properties. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in savanna and woodland habitats. Gochnatia rosei is also valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional uses in local communities.
